intro: Pedicularis crenata, commonly known as the serrated lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes numerous parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite and often have a serrated edge, contributing to its common name. Pedicularis crenata typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, often in association with other hemiparasitic plants.
